clusters.title: Greenlandic prime minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen: "Greenland is not for sale"

items.title: Greenlandic prime minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen: "Greenland is not for sale"
items.standfirst: The third and final day of the Munich Security Conference is set to focus on Europe, with speakers including European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde and the EU’s foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas, after European allies expressed some relief on Saturday when US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Washington was not seeking to undermine the transatlantic alliance, despite reiterating criticism of EU immigration and climate policies, while tensions persisted as Denmark’s prime minister said she believed Donald Trump’s ambition to seize Greenland remained unchanged; meanwhile, our FRANCE 24 correspondent Nick Holdsworth spoke with Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen, who reiterated that Greenland “is not for sale.”
items.content: The third and final day of the Munich Security Conference is set to focus on Europe, with speakers including European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde and the EU’s foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas, after European allies expressed some relief on Saturday when US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Washington was not seeking to undermine the transatlantic alliance, despite reiterating criticism of EU immigration and climate policies, while tensions persisted as Denmark’s prime minister said she believed Donald Trump’s ambition to seize Greenland remained unchanged; meanwhile, our FRANCE 24 correspondent Nick Holdsworth spoke with Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen, who reiterated that Greenland “is not for sale.”

items.title: What did Marco Rubio tell European leaders in Munich? #politics
items.standfirst: The message Rubio took to the Munich Security Conference At the Munich Security Conference, Secretary of State Marco Rubio framed the United States as a committed transatlantic partner while pushing a muscular vision of Western cohesion. He used the high profile platform to reassure European…

items.title: Rubio calls for U.S. and Europe to "revitalize an old friendship"
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio made it clear the Trump administration would stick to its guns on policy, but offered a tone seen as softer and more reassuring.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio made it clear the Trump administration would stick to its guns on policy, but offered a tone seen as softer and more reassuring.

items.title: Rubio delivers charm offensive at Munich conference
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Saturday spoke to European leaders attending the annual Munich Security Conference. Rubio sought to calm some fears that months of sharp U.S. rhetoric and policy disputes had opened a lasting breach between Washington and its European allies. Olivia Gazis has more.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Saturday spoke to European leaders attending the annual Munich Security Conference. Rubio sought to calm some fears that months of sharp U.S. rhetoric and policy disputes had opened a lasting breach between Washington and its European allies. Olivia Gazis has more.

items.title: How did Marco Rubio reassure European leaders in Munich? #world
items.standfirst: A message of continuity — conditional and prodding At the Munich Security Conference, the U.S. Secretary of State struck a deliberately reassuring tone toward Europe while pressing allies to change policy in ways the U.S. views as necessary. The central thrust was to say the transatlantic…

items.title: Rubio says US and Europe 'belong together' despite tensions
items.standfirst: The US secretary of state reassures European leaders that the Trump administration backs the transatlantic alliance.
items.content: The US secretary of state reassures European leaders that the Trump administration backs the transatlantic alliance.

items.title: Rubio says US and Europe "belong together"
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio sought to assuage European leaders' worries about fraying ties with Washington as he addressed the Munich Security Conference on Saturday, telling the annual gathering that Europe and the US "belong together" and that Washington wants to "revitalise" the transatlantic alliance. France24 journalist Andrew Hilliar explains.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio sought to assuage European leaders' worries about fraying ties with Washington as he addressed the Munich Security Conference on Saturday, telling the annual gathering that Europe and the US "belong together" and that Washington wants to "revitalise" the transatlantic alliance. France24 journalist Andrew Hilliar explains.

items.title: Marco Rubio has warmer words for Europe weeks after Trump's harsh Davos comments

items.title: US strikes dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria in retaliation for deadly ambush

clusters.title: NASA's crew-12 docks at International Space Station
clusters.neutral_headline: NASA Crew Arrives at Space Station

items.title: NASA's crew-12 docks at International Space Station
items.standfirst: Four astronauts docked at the International Space Station on Saturday for a research mission set to last several months. Among the crew is Sophie Adenot, who joins two American astronauts and one Russian, becoming only the second French woman to travel into space. The new team is replacing a previous crew that was forced to return to Earth early because of a medical issue, as Morgan Ayre reports.
items.content: Four astronauts docked at the International Space Station on Saturday for a research mission set to last several months. Among the crew is Sophie Adenot, who joins two American astronauts and one Russian, becoming only the second French woman to travel into space. The new team is replacing a previous crew that was forced to return to Earth early because of a medical issue, as Morgan Ayre reports.

items.title: France's Sophie Adenot and crew arrive at International Space Station
items.standfirst: France's Sophie Adenot and her fellow Crew-12 members docked at the International Space Station late on Saturday for the start of their months-long mission aboard the orbiting laboratory, where a medical evacuation earlier this year left a skeleton crew of just three astronauts. Adenot is only the second French woman to fly to space.
items.content: France's Sophie Adenot and her fellow Crew-12 members docked at the International Space Station late on Saturday for the start of their months-long mission aboard the orbiting laboratory, where a medical evacuation earlier this year left a skeleton crew of just three astronauts. Adenot is only the second French woman to fly to space.

items.title: Astronauts hug and high-five as new crew arrive at International Space Station
items.standfirst: Four new astronauts have arrived at the International Space Station to replace their colleagues who pulled out early over health concerns.
items.content: Four new astronauts have arrived at the International Space Station to replace their colleagues who pulled out early over health concerns.

items.title: Four people on NASA'S Crew-12 arrive at the International Space Station
items.standfirst: The crew will spend the next eight months conducting experiments to prepare for human exploration beyond Earth's orbit.
items.content: The crew will spend the next eight months conducting experiments to prepare for human exploration beyond Earth's orbit.(Image credit: NASA)

items.title: Four new astronauts arrive via SpaceX rocket at International Space Station
items.standfirst: ISS now fully crewed after a medical issue forced the evacuation of four astronauts in JanuaryThe International Space Station (ISS) returned to full strength with Saturday’s arrival of four new astronauts to replace colleagues who bailed early because of health concerns.SpaceX delivered the US, French and Russian astronauts a day after launching them from Cape Canaveral. Continue reading...
items.content: ISS now fully crewed after a medical issue forced the evacuation of four astronauts in JanuaryThe International Space Station (ISS) returned to full strength with Saturday’s arrival of four new astronauts to replace colleagues who bailed early because of health concerns.SpaceX delivered the US, French and Russian astronauts a day after launching them from Cape Canaveral. Continue reading...

Crew replaces previous team that returned to Earth early

clusters.title: DHS shutdown begins as funding expires without a deal in Congress

items.title: DHS shutdown begins as funding expires without a deal in Congress
items.standfirst: It's the second time in as many weeks that government funding has lapsed as Democrats and the White House remain at an impasse over immigration enforcement policies.
items.content: It's the second time in as many weeks that government funding has lapsed as Democrats and the White House remain at an impasse over immigration enforcement policies.

items.title: DHS shutdown begins with no deal in sight
items.standfirst: Funding for the Department of Homeland Security has ground to a halt in a dispute in Congress over the Trump administration's immigration crackdown. The partial shutdown was impacting the Transportation Security Administration, the Coast Guard and FEMA, among other agencies. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: Funding for the Department of Homeland Security has ground to a halt in a dispute in Congress over the Trump administration's immigration crackdown. The partial shutdown was impacting the Transportation Security Administration, the Coast Guard and FEMA, among other agencies. Willie James Inman reports.

items.standfirst: What happened and what it means Congress failed to pass a funding measure to keep the Department of Homeland Security running beyond its short term deadline, and lawmakers departed Washington without a deal. The immediate result is a partial lapse in DHS funding that affects most of the…

items.title: Limited government shutdown likely to linger for at least 10 days as Congress takes break
items.standfirst: 13% of federal civilian workforce is affected, although DHS – which spurred budget standoff – remains fundedA limited US government shutdown came into effect on Saturday – the third of Donald Trump’s second term – after negotiations between the White House and Democrats in Congress failed to agree on new restrictions for federal immigration agents.The shutdown affects about 13% of the federal civilian workforce and is confined to agencies under the umbrella of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), which screens airline passengers. Continue reading...
items.content: 13% of federal civilian workforce is affected, although DHS – which spurred budget standoff – remains fundedA limited US government shutdown came into effect on Saturday – the third of Donald Trump’s second term – after negotiations between the White House and Democrats in Congress failed to agree on new restrictions for federal immigration agents.The shutdown affects about 13% of the federal civilian workforce and is confined to agencies under the umbrella of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), which screens airline passengers. Continue reading...

clusters.title: 'Clown show': Obama speaks out on Trump racist monkey clip, Minneapolis crackdown
clusters.neutral_headline: Obama Addresses Racist Video Shared by Trump

items.title: 'Clown show': Obama speaks out on Trump racist monkey clip, Minneapolis crackdown
items.standfirst: Former US president Barack Obama on Saturday addressed a racist video posted on President Donald Trump's social media account, telling a podcast host that the "decorum" that once guided public officials has been lost. Obama also lamented the "rogue behaviour" of federal agents involved in a deadly immigration crackdown in Minneapolis and praised local communities for pushing back against the operations.
items.content: Former US president Barack Obama on Saturday addressed a racist video posted on President Donald Trump's social media account, telling a podcast host that the "decorum" that once guided public officials has been lost. Obama also lamented the "rogue behaviour" of federal agents involved in a deadly immigration crackdown in Minneapolis and praised local communities for pushing back against the operations.

items.title: Obama addresses racist video shared by Trump depicting him as an ape
items.standfirst: The former US president didn't name Trump, but lamented the lack of "shame" and "decorum" among public officials.
items.content: The former US president didn't name Trump, but lamented the lack of "shame" and "decorum" among public officials.

clusters.title: French prosecutors to set up special team to review Epstein files

items.title: French prosecutors to set up special team to review Epstein files
items.standfirst: Magistrates will analyse evidence that could implicate French nationals and re-examine case of Jean-Luc BrunelThe Paris prosecutor’s office on Saturday announced it was setting up a special team of magistrates to analyse evidence that could implicate French nationals in the crimes of the convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.With Epstein’s known circle extending to prominent French figures after the release of documents by the US authorities, the prosecutor’s office said it would also thoroughly re-examine the case of former French modelling agency executive Jean-Luc Brunel, a close associate of the US financier, who died in custody in 2022. Continue reading...
items.content: Magistrates will analyse evidence that could implicate French nationals and re-examine case of Jean-Luc BrunelThe Paris prosecutor’s office on Saturday announced it was setting up a special team of magistrates to analyse evidence that could implicate French nationals in the crimes of the convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.With Epstein’s known circle extending to prominent French figures after the release of documents by the US authorities, the prosecutor’s office said it would also thoroughly re-examine the case of former French modelling agency executive Jean-Luc Brunel, a close associate of the US financier, who died in custody in 2022. Continue reading...

items.title: French prosecutors announce special team to analyse Epstein files
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor's office on Saturday announced it was setting up a special team to analyse files relating to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and investigate suspected crimes involving French nationals. As part of that initiative, they will be reopening their files on the late Jean-Luc Brunel, a former French modelling agency executive.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor's office on Saturday announced it was setting up a special team to analyse files relating to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and investigate suspected crimes involving French nationals. As part of that initiative, they will be reopening their files on the late Jean-Luc Brunel, a former French modelling agency executive.

ai_summary: French prosecutors set up special team to analyze Epstein files
Team to investigate suspected crimes involving French nationals
Prosecutors to re-examine case of Jean-Luc Brunel
Epstein's circle included prominent French figures
Prosecutors to thoroughly analyze evidence
